title: If someone on your team says they have trouble playing against a specific champ
body:
You're way better off banning that champ than something else entirely because it's "meta OP". 

Like, if you're in bronze and your ADC says they have trouble with dodging Blitz grabs fucking ban Blitz over something like Zed or Vayne who are only objectively strong if played w/ a high amount of skill (ie: not in bronze). On which note don't yell at your first pick for banning out a champion they have trouble with even if it's not "OP" (I admit it's selfish to put all three bans towards your own lane, but if they use **one** like that then who cares. It's so THEY don't feed, which is a good thing) 

(Note I'm talking about ranked here, it's probably better to encourage people to lrn how to beat their nightmare champs in normals)

Slightly off-topic, but as someone who likes Nasus, here are some tips for playing against him:

1) He really struggles under heavy harass. If you can keep him below 75%, he'll probably be more careful, which means more missed CS, which means less stacks. In turn, this means he can't push as hard when you need to leave lane.

2) Since he's so immobile, you can comfortably poke from a distance. If you know you'll be against a Nasus, try to pick a ranged toplaner who can stay away-- when gank time comes, leave tanking to the jungler, unless you're bait.

Absolutely agree with you that the ban picks should be tailored to the team. 

The generic case scenario of "ban conflict" is more like: Player 1 wants to ban champion A, B and C, and Player 2 wants to ban champion E, F & G. This is based on the assumption of player 1 is having trouble dealing with Champion A, B and C, and Player 2 is having trouble dealing with champion E, F & G. (This case of scenario is a bit extreme, as general conflict is probably only 1 champ ban instead of all 3 champs bans). For problem isolation, assume the opponent team will not ban any of the champs that Player 1 and Player 2 wants to ban. 

How would you suggest resolving the ban conflict in above scenario?

A while back, in an explanation as to why we cannot have a number-of-bans increase, Zil explained that the number of bans were meant to signify, and for the use of, the number of "z" class champions - essentially the champions that were considered over-powered, but not yet nerfed.  If this remains the case, it makes it hard justifying any particular ban for any other reason but to ban overpowered/easily abused champions.  Not to say the other team would pick those champions (in fact, you may be able to pick said champion before the other team does), but it does make it harder to react in specific cases like these.

Just my two cents.

Agreed, the best situation would be taking the champs that need to be banned so we save our ban slot. 

In situation when above case scenario doesn't occur, I know we should be compromising between 2 players, but the way how I thought is... bot lane has two champs. when one gets screwed, it will lead to both champs lose gold/exp. That would be 40% of your team that are in disadvantage.

I hate to say this, but if I were in ban position, I would probably just allow pick the best bans for ADC/Support. My favor goes to ADC/Support/Jungle/Mid/Top. The only reason I have this order is because the amount of team fight that each role are in early game. (Obviously this doesn't happen as always, you sure may have all the team fight on top lane. But this is generally true as bot usually have more team fights and Jungler usually gank bot more than gank mid/top). 

This not meant to be a right/wrong answer. I just wanted to know what majority ppl would do in this situation. I'm still a silver, and is still in the learning process...

Compromising. Talk to the team to see if anyone is playing a champion that makes a ban unnecessary. Supports and junglers in particular can shut down problematic people. Sometimes team-oriented top/midlaners can also do this. Something like this:

Player A: "I want to ban leona, morgana and caitlyn because I'm going ADC and they're my nightmares."
Player B: "But I'm going mid and I want Akali, Katarina and Zed banned!"

The ideal situation is to say, for example:

Player C: "I'm going Janna support, my Q can stop Leona's E in mid-dash, so she never gets to stun you, and my shield can mitigate Caitlyn's poke. I can also buy a Mikael's against Morgana but admittedly it's no guarantee."
Player D: "I'm going Lissandra top. If we get Akali or Zed, we can lane-swap. They're not an inconvenience to me. Katarina's trickier, but I can make do as well."
Player E: "Fizz is pretty annoying, even if you're going as Lissandra. We should consider a ban for him."

So the players decide that they want to ban Morgana, Katarina and Fizz, and they start the game already establishing the basics of teamwork.

A/B + C + D/E, obviously.
Edit: The post originally said Player 1 had trouble with ABC and Player 2 had trouble with CDE. It got changed without mention after I pointed out the clear solution.

Assess which player has a 'best' champion that can be first picked by the team leader. So if player 1 is best with CY and the TL can pick CY and swap, ban Champs ADE. Helps to balance both players as best you can.
